hook.text: Until the early 1900s, all young boys in the West wore dresses. Every single one.

buildup.text: Around age 5 to 7, boys went through 'breeching'â€”the day they first wore trousers.

discovery.text: It was a major family event. The boy was leaving babyhood and entering the male world.

twist.text: Franklin D. Roosevelt was photographed at age 2 in a white dress with long hair. No one blinked.

climax.text: The tradition died when mass manufacturing made tiny trousers cheap. Commerce killed the ceremony.

punchline.text: Boys in dresses was normal for centuries.

quiz.question: What was the 'breeching ceremony'?
options: A boy's first time wearing trousers, marking his entry into boyhood
A ritual where boys received their first military uniform
A coming-of-age ceremony at age 18 involving formal suits
